This stuff only being mentioned later as it happens makes the movie feel way less exciting than the docs. In the main doc you feel the tension. You know what happens when. You also see other workers crawl into small tunnels on top of the mountain to see if they can get in that way. They can't. This shows just how much work they did and also illustrates there was only 1 way to get the 12 boys out. The movie does show all the main events, but you really need to know the story to understand why a certain early scene is actually way more crucial than it looks like in the movie.I think the romantic dating events would have added the needed personal touch and connection to the country. And then showing the local town for a short moment. I did like how the movie just presented the men as regular guys. Kinda normal, even a bit fearful middle aged men. Not good looking, not that fit, not that brave, not heroic. Just doing what they do best. It's rare you see this in a movie. And all in all it's by far the best cave diving movie I have seen with nothing else even half as good. I tried to watch all the ones I could find and many have terrible camerawork and silly unrealistic stories. This one is the first one I can fully recommend to any type of viewer. It's not just the first good cave diving movie, but also a very good movie based on a real life rescue scenario as these movies tend to be cheap and silly. This one never tries any humor or fake drama and you actually see the actors do diving scenes. I do wish they had used more 3D graphics and showed way more diving. That's frankly why we watch the movie: we want to see actual diving. Instead they gave us a few short shots of the divers in a fake cave. More than you could do 20 years ago, but way less than you can do today if you use a Gopro in a real cave system. Should have used real cave divers and picked a few good caves.Overall recommended. It's not tension filled and lacks movie magic. But if you have seen the real story already you are going to enjoy this one. If you are totally uninterested in the real story and just want a great movie, then maybe this is not for you. The movie runs long, and does feel hollow unless you can input your own emotions into it.

One of the most exciting rescues that they have given us in recent times is the one brought to the screen by the great Ron Howard in Thirteen Lives. The film based on the tragedy of the children of Thailand, is one of the most exciting surprises of the year and leaves the feeling that it should have been enjoyed longer in cinemas.A fairly solid recreation is the one that its director offers us about the planning and subsequent development of a rescue that seemed impossible and that ends with a satisfactory ending. Howard manages to take us at all times to the tension of being trapped in a cave for more than 20 days.The story is supported in a good way on the shoulders of Viggo Mortensen and Colín Farrell who mix well with a totally international cast. With fairly correct performances, the film manages to convey the tension and anguish that such a tragedy means.The drama grows throughout its 142-minute runtime and that is Howard's virtue that maintains the connection with the viewer throughout its duration, knowing that we all already knew the end of the story. The work that the director and cast do to bring you the reality of a tragedy in the most natural and credible way possible, allows us as viewers to always remain attentive to every detail.Technically, the work is really surprising, Howard is not limited to putting the camera as one of those who collaborate with the mission and that allows us to experience the anguish from the first person, with great sequences underwater and out of it, in addition to having always that tension on screen without ever losing track of what was at stake.The surprise ends up being that we find ourselves with a really solid and forceful film, taking the best of those films based on real events, it allows itself to maintain reality, without neglecting the fictional drama that a story brings to the cinema. A great plus achieved by his script and his direction, a story in good hands, always ends up being a good result.

This film is well done. Great cast and directing. But seriously please watch The Rescue. It hits harder and is right from the source of the divers and those involved. Breathtaking heroic story and human spirit.

reviews.review_title: A stellar epic about stellar heroism from a stellar director at his best - outstanding
reviews.content: "Thirteen Lives" is a stellar epic about stellar heroism from stellar-director Ron Howard at his best. In 2018 12 boys & their footie coach got trapped by flash floods deep inside a Thai mountain, garnering international attenion & support - including from Brit cave divers Colin Farrell & Viggo Mortensen, later joined by the likes of Aussie Joel Edgerton (all giving superbly understated performances). Howard (and top writer William Nicholson) take their captivated audience with the would-be rescuers into the dark, claustrophobic, submerged tunnels, while also skillfully conveying the amazing, rich communal Thai spirit outside. It's just brilliant film-making. Outstanding.

reviews.review_title: Did you miss the boat MGM
reviews.content:
I have read a major review of this film where the
reviewer was mystified how MGM did not
give this film masterpiece a cinema release. ?
As an analogy one might say that a film such as
1917 could of been sent to streaming straight away
because of woke Hollywood.I wouldn't care , in Thirteen Lives a lot of Thai
actors took major roles .. I am afraid Hollywood
in certain true stories the stars have to have
something in common with the real people they
are playing.I have given this film 10 stars because it is in the
same class as Ron Howards other 13 film. Apollo 13.The film is a masterpiece , in all aspects. And nothing more needs to be said. Other than MGM you
are going to miss a horde of Academy Awards .More fool you.

reviews.review_title: An exciting rescue operation to bring home 12 teenagers and coach
reviews.content: Movies on rescue operations are always exciting whether the leader of the group is Vin Diesel or Jason Statham or Bruce Willis or Sylvester Stallone or Liam Neeson etc etc. The plot of this movie set in Thailand is slightly different in the sense that 12 teenaged soccer players with their coach are marooned in a flooded and very narrow long tunnel. This rescue presents quite a challenge in terms of planning and execution. The movie is based on true events which took place in Thailand in 2018. Two Brits ,Viggo Mortensen and Colin Farell ( experts in diving and under water rescue) have been requisitioned by the Governor of the province. They are able to reach the marooned group after wading through a kilometre of flood water, they shoot a video to show all that they are OK and report back with this info so that appropriate rescue teams can get into action.Director Ron Howard had a complex and challenging task at hand. There is no doubt that he has made an absorbing movie surmounting all hurdles of shooting under difficult conditions. However one only wishes that this 130 minutes run time could have been cropped by 30 minutes or so to give the movie a taut and smart look. Presently the scenes tend to get monotonous in the docudrama format. Cinematography of the rescue is done exceedingly well with considerable amount of underwater work. The scenes are realistically shot and tend to give you a claustrophobic feeling what with the soundtrack full of sounds of gushing water, dragging of oxygen tanks, laboured breathing etc. The scenes are palpably tense, but one wonders whether was it an overdose keeping in mind the long run time.

reviews.review_title: Dramatized retelling of the Thai cave rescue the whole world is familiar with.
reviews.content: Ron Howard's take on one of the toughest rescues which spanned over 18 days, though commendable lacks enough dramatic moments. The film starts with the kids deciding to visit the cave after their game while their parents are waiting for them to attend a birthday organized by them all. The unexpected rain cause the flood and the parents are informed the kids along with their coach are stuck inside the flooded cave. It is hereafter, the known faces make their entry as a British rescuers kickstarting the rescue mission against all odds.I wished the film to have presented the survivors perspective as well along with the rescuers pov. Instead, it is all about the preparation of the rescue mission which took much of the screen time followed by the actual rescue. The final 20 odd minutes indeed were effective, pushing to the edge of the seat experience with the final rescue. But the narrative pace here is extremely slow making one ask for more dramatization of the actual event.It is still a commendable attempt nevertheless but I had higher expectations from this which it didn't meet.

I like it. It doesn't try to be an emotional movie . Just let the true story tell itself. You will see part of the dive rescue to let the children go out more than any movie or documentary that come before.The movie keep us to watch it from start to the end. Eventhough we know the end but we still feel excite along the movie.Well done Ron Howard.

reviews.review_title: Compelling story about a spectacular, unlikely rescue
reviews.content: Ron Howard has created an on-the-edge of your seat suspenseful three-and-a-half hour cinema treat that documents the story of the 12 young soccer players and their coach, trapped in a flooded cave just four short years ago. Many comparisons have been made to Apollo 13, with thousands of people rallying to help three astronauts return home in a broken spaceship, but it's a different type of story reflecting nuances and choices through the process.First, the story gets told almost entirely from the viewpoint of the parents, the British and Thai rescue dive teams, and the locals who try to divert flood water from the cave. Here and there, the movie manages to show bits and pieces of Thai/Buddhist culture from the way the coach helped the boys to meditate to cope with their ordeal to mention of the "sleeping princess" aspect of the mountain with the cave. Locals outside of the cave are also shown praying at various times.Viggo Mortenson and Colin Farrell portray two members of the British rescue team, but both go about their roles in a stoic, subdued manner. The actual rescue was even more treacherous than was shown in the film because the murky water in the flooded cave providing nearly zero visibility. As a certified diver myself, cave diving requires extensive training and nerves of steel and that's when the water is spring-fed clear, so this gives one a new appreciation for the brave British and Thai men who had to feel their way around the stalagtites and rock outcroppings.The delicate balance of anesthetizing the boys and the coach in order to carry them out of the cave represents as complicated a problem as the corridor control burns in Apollo 13 yet the directors wisely avoid overwhelming the viewer with the medical details. They do manage to show how harrowing the 13 rescues were. It was 13 dives through murky water lasting four to five hours long!In the end, it's a celebration of the human spirit and human ingenuity. Outside the cave, the locals also improvise pipe out of bamboo stalks to help divert water from the cave. When all the boys, the coach, and the rescue divers are accounted for, the celebration is a subdued whew of relief rather than a fist-pumping, war whooping spectacle, yet another wise choice for the production team.See it! Although, if you're claustrophobic some of the action may be hard to watch!

reviews.review_title: Pales compared to The Rescue by NatGeo
reviews.content: Hollywood letdown. Choppy skits. No character development, no storyline, no follow-through. Boring. The entire movie just had characters magically show up at the cave then go diving. They share two or three sentences then swim some more. Not surprised, because it's tough to follow the great 2021 NatGeo doc, The Rescue.This was a missed opportunity by Ron Howard and company. No behind scenes military discussions or strategic planning. No back stories on how families discovered or how they endured over two weeks of the unknown. Instead, we get one mother with wide eyes and one father who can't thank the authorities enough. The screenplay was childish and cliché.The true life story was intense and followed by the entire world. This movie had no build up, nothing gripping, and no grand ending. What about the 13 lives? All we got was one kid and a birthday cake. What about the collaboration between and across countries? This movie gave us nothing. No one cares about who ate the cookies.I'm giving this two stars just for the somewhat good acting from Farrell, Mortensen, and Edgerton. Too bad the production was epically poor.

This is by far one of the best movies I've seen in a long time. Although I already knew the outcome I was still engaged the entire time and it did not feel over 2 hours long. It focuses mostly on the divers rescue and rescue teams. I cannot imagine the mental and physical strain everyone endured over those days. We don't see very much of the boys and the coach but I don't think it detracted from the movie. Definitely worth the watch!

This movie shows that there is nothing that we all can't do if the whole world comes together. Unfortunately we have to have 12 innocent kids and an amazing coach trapped in a cave for this to happen. I wish and hope that humanity learns before it is too late.Anyway let's talk about The movie. Ron Howard is back!!!!!Movie gets into the thick of things immediately and doesn't let go. It stays intense throughout while not losing the emotional and humanitarian aspect of the movie while still making sure that even though most of the movie is in a cave, we do not forget that we are in Northern Thailand bordering Myanmar and the cultural aesthetics are not forgotten.And now the performances!!!They were excellent. There was no over the top stuff here. Ron probably did a good amount of research but the pedigree he brings makes sure that the professional actors understand that they are playing professional divers who have to keep their ego in check, understand that they are in a foreign country and look at the bigger picture while not losing sight that they are here to save lives and making sure that they do not die themselves. Viggo and Colin show that sometimes showing restraint in such performances is everything. Viggo is more used to these kind of performances than Colin but both did an excellent job. The Thai actors did a good job and the kids were awesome and I am happy they made them speak Northern Thai language rather than English making their performances even more believable.Definitely 9/10.

reviews.review_title: Ron Howard captures the diver experience beautifully
reviews.content: I have watched several documentaries on the Thai Cave rescue. I watched the situation live while it happened. But Ron Howard truly gives the viewer the ability to experience and see what the divers, kids, and volunteers went through. I empathized with the divers. The movie opened my eyes to the miracle on how they saved them all. Fantastic movie. Beautifully mastered.

reviews.review_title: Exciting!! Watched it twice in a week!!
reviews.content: I came into this movie not knowing what it was about, and was blown away by how intense it was. The whole movie is gripping, and you definitely don't feel the 2.5 hour runtime. It's even better that the story is based on an actual event, making it much more intense while you watch.All the acting is spot on, especially feels great that they got Thai actors to tell the story that happened there. The diving also feels very authentic, and every time they go in you feel the space close around you...It's crazy how there was such a natural twist in the way they get the kids out - did not expect it at all! Knowing that it actually happened makes it even more incredible!Overall was an amazing movie, a great ride and would definitely recommend it to watch!!

reviews.review_title: Superb. Might be Ron Howard's best
reviews.content: When a film is good, often there is less to say. I remember the story, I watched the documentary, and still my wife and I were riveted by this.This film is all story, zero fat. Amazing the over two hour run time, but every moment is necessary in this tale of harrowing rescue.Colin Farrell especially stands out. Farrell is a character actor in a leading man's body. He inhabits the role of John. Viggo Mortensen and Joel Edgerton are perfect as Rick and Harry.Director Howard shows great restraint and yet the film indulges in every way it should. There are really no embellishments, either. It happened like this.Bravo to all involved; in the rescue, in the documentation and this dramatization.Life is sacred.

A story told with sincerity and truthfulness that still has you on the edge of your seat despite the absence of super heroes, action stunts and special effects.That does not mean that there aren't heroes. In fact there are heroes everywhere: ordinary people stepping up in a crisis to do extraordinary things. Thousands of volunteers from all over the world.Critical to the rescue are the British cave divers that find the boys and later go back to bring them out. But they are building on the work of so many others, such as the team coach who kept the boys going through so many days before they were found, the Thai navy seals and the volunteers diverting water from the bore holes above the caves. Also critical is the local Governor, who performs magnificently in the face of incredible pressure.The reason that it works is that the true story is so incredible and needs no embellishment. News coverage at the time had not made me realise just how difficult - well nigh impossible in fact - this rescue was. The film does justice to the story and all involved. It was a real privilege to watch their story.

reviews.review_title: I have new profound appreciation for the people at the rescue
reviews.content: I was always aware of the Thai Cave rescue but I never truly understood the challenge that the people faced during the rescue. This film succeeds in giving me an appreciation for everyone involved in this rescue.Ron Howard delivers a gripping dramatization of the story and manages to keep it suspenseful, despite knowing the resolution. I also appreciate that the movie isn't just about the British Cavers and that the movie gives a lot of focus to what the Thai people die as well. It also helps that all the actors from Viggo, Colin to the Thai actors, give a great performance.Thirteen Lives is a great retelling of the rescue and I highly recommend it.

Of course I heard of this story during the time it was all over the news back in 2018, but I didn't realize how outstanding and heart warming the details actually were until I came across the documentary named "The Rescue" that depicts the intricacies and stories of all involved on this operation.I was absolutely amazed and actually emotional through most of the documentary, something that's not that common when I watch movies or TV shows these days, a proof of what true humanity actually is and the insane amount of courage and peace of mind those kids were able to display with the help of their coach, out of this world.I then decided to give this movie a chance, already fully aware of the story through the documentary I wanted to have the opportunity to see how Hollywood was going to adapt the story based on all the details already shared through the documentary.I have to be honest, they really nailed this one! I believe this is a respectful accurate adaptation probably one of the best I've seen as a movie. Movies based on true events tend to highly dramatize events and specific situations but this felt like a very realistic and on point re-telling of that unthinkable rescue. The locations, the editing, the camera work, the actors (Viggo amazing as always) everything just really spot on, and probably the most important aspect of all that goes against the trend of most Hollywood movies these days and I never tire to criticize, they depicted a story that take place in another country where most of the involved are Thai native and they were bold enough to not only hire Thai actors but also to have a big portion of the movie spoken in Thai.I cannot tell you the amount of frustration I have watching American productions telling stories from other countries and they decide to just keep it in English sometimes just making a weird and fake accent, it loses its essence entirely, my respect to Ron Howard to have the courage to make this, I feel this might be one of the snubs for the Academy Awards this year.

If the movie had a better direction to the story, and it was 30 minutes shorter, it would be a 7/10. Overlong and flabby, it's a 6/10. IT IS NOT WORTH THE RUNTIME.When the movie starts... for like 25 minutes I was wondering wtf is this movie going for. It's very all over the place in a weird way that kept me looking for a tone that just didn't exist. I think what happened is they wanted to make a movie about a thing and they had very little idea about a direction. The focus kept shifting to unrelated threads, introducing characters and details that never mattered, and in the end only fleshes out like 3-4 characters by the end. Which is kinda pathetic given the runtime. I watched it mostly at 1.25x speed, because IT IS NOT WORTH THE RUNTIME.Meh. It was fine. Wouldn't recommend, though.

reviews.review_title: Very little to say... besides SEE IT!
reviews.content: My heart was firmly lodged in my throat for the last hour and a half of Thirteen Lives. Nobody does true-story heroism like Ron Howard, and the people behind the true story of this film were just that... TRUE HEROES!!!Though Howard fictionalizes his subjects, and does not pretend to make documentaries, he does accurately depict the feeling and the major points of his subjects in this one! It almost feels like a beautiful re-enactment. In all honesty it feels like you are actually there.Vigo and Colin absolutely killed it. What excellent acting! They each deserve an Oscar for this. And I hope they get it this year!Those who have run into my reviews may note that this is one of my shortest. Please understand that I really don't think there's much to say about this simple, beautiful and very human story, besides - see it!

I was debating between an 8 and 9 but ultimately decided to go up because I really just love movies based on true stories. I think it was beautifully depicted and held strong to the reality of the situation.I loved that a story as recent as this was made into a movie and I hope that film makers continue to look for true stories to depict.The best part of this movie for me was that even though I had a rough idea of what happens in the end, there were enough twists and story to keep me hungry for more.Shout out to the boys and their coach for such courage.I took off one point mostly because I do feel like 2.5 hours is a bit excessive for length.

Watched this on a Craig recommendation. Didn't know the story (of course ... who reads the news?) so it kept my attention throughout. I get the feeling that if I had known how it turned out I would have been a little bit bored in parts.Ron Howard did a great job with the story and the diving sequences.I didn't think the Thai acting was great - but the broad English accents from the main leads were great.All in all a solid movie that I think got all it could out of the material.73/100.

I'd like to start my comments with a nod to Colin Farrell. This man can act. I've seen him in many films and thought he was outstanding in Saving Mr Banks.In this film he takes on the role of the English diver and at first I couldn't concentrate on the film as I was just amazed at his performance - his accent, his demeanour.... I thought Johnny Depp was the only what I call actor (someone who takes on different roles and is totally different - unlike the Tom Hanks, Wil Smith's of this world). Colin is very talented.Anyway we all know the story, and seeing the events unfolding is moving and exciting too.Great acting by all.

Thirteen Lives, the new movie from Hollywood Emphasizes the kindness, friendship and good things that humans have for each other.Help at Tham Luang this time It's true that we waste a lot of resources to save all 13 lives we've lost. It's not a waste But what do we get in return? ...Too many from this event.

Most people are talking about the film "Prey". And while I get the excitement, I don't hear enough people talk about "Thirteen Lives". And in my opinion, it's a very tense film was fantastic cinematography and directing from Ron Howard, and while it does drag a bit in its first act, it does get much better in acts 2 and 3, which makes up for the first act. I love the underwater scenes in the cave, and the editing and cinematography really help give those scenes a sense of depth and tension, which adds greatly to this film. Overall, it's an immensely tense thrill-ride, which I think is the best film of August.

reviews.review_title: One of the best rescue movies I've ever seen. Truly captivating from start to finish.
reviews.content: It's around 2:30 hour long, but there wasn't a moment when I was bored. It kept me intrigued & tense throughout. It's best quality is that it doesn't feel like a movie. It feels real. The whole rescue operation seems real. The movie budget must've been really high because it's not easy to portray a believable disaster/rescue situation. I watched it with my family with people from a wide age group, and they all loved it. This movie deserves far more popularity than what it has gotten. I hope that changes over time. Do watch it with your friends or family!

They did what they were suppose to recruited the right people and with the help of the city and volunteers they helped make a 6 hour trip, 3 hours to help get the boys out I'm so glad they did all the hard work they did to help defenitley a great movie.

reviews.review_title: Cave rescue story told with honesty & clarity
reviews.content: Ron Howard directs this excellent film about the dramatic rescue of 13 Thai footballers in 2019 who got trapped in a flooded cave in Northern Thailand. Avoiding sentimentality and using local actors, non actors, as well of course as a couple of star names, Howard creates a gripping narrative that does genuinely engage - quite an achievement considering that the overwhelming majority of the audience would know the outcome of the story. It's all high quality, carried out with a strongly authentic feel, and is well worth a watch.

It's fairly decent. Some weird parts like trying to make the rescue effort from the Thai side look better than it was in reality and a couple entirely unnecessary inaccuracies and "dramatizations", aka lies, messed with the overall feel I was left with. Could've just stuck more to reality.

The film is amazing for a truly amazing miracle of a rescue! I have renewed faith in the human spirit that feels so lost in today's world. This film brought tears to my eyes several times. What heroes those divers and everyone who volunteered for this rescue mission are! This film is a must watch!

To be honest, I don't watch many movies these days because the ones I have watched were boring, the story was awful or the acting was forgettable.... I have finally found a great movie...when I saw who was directing this film, I decided it was worth a watch & I was correct...Ron Howard is a genius director who knows how to tell a story that grabs you & pulls you emotionally directly into the scenes...this true event also makes you feel very humble and in awe of what can be accomplished when people of different nationalities from various countries voluntarily work together with one goal in mind..in this case to save lives. Great story, wonderful acting by everyone involved & an amazing, brilliant director...doesn't get any better than this.

Great performance from Viggo and Colin. The story is told with no drama, very real life facts, no dramatic music and well done for that.More like live documentary from the rescue divers perspective. The underwater scenes and sounds are brilliant, so much it makes you out of breath too. Glad the story was told in Thai and characters speaking Thai and only international helpers were speaking English.No special effects (at least I couldn't tell) and everything looked so real.Also, I didn't realise the kids were sedated for transfer which made me really anxious for their airways and breathing haha.Definitely a must see.

reviews.review_title: It's been long since we had a good movie like this one
reviews.content: Such a great great movie, much recommend!!I rated this one 10/10 because honestly they did such a great job sticking to the details, presenting the story and events best they could. I was hooked beginning to end, never got bored or wanted to end faster, I only wanted to see how everything goes. I loved everything about it, I sincerely don't understand why the overall reviews is that low, it deserves to be 8.5/10 and higher. I recommend everyone who knows the story and doesn't know the story to watch it. I cried, laughed, was stressed and relieved, i felt like I'm one of the parents, or one of the volunteers.

reviews.review_title: A Totally Engaging and Fitting Tribute
reviews.content: Ron Howard knocks it out the park once more with this gripping retelling of the rescue of thirteen lads from a flooded cave in a Thailand. It's inevitable with the telling of true stories that the challenge is going to be the lack of surprise but Howard more than compensates with that 'on the scene' feel, the casting, attention to detail and brilliant camera work. The whole thing feels utterly authentic with the monsoon rain, mud and deluge of mountain streams - let alone the flooded cave itself (you don't question it while watching but afterwards I'm thinking - how did they do that?). Then there is the cultural context, the dramatic mountain scenery, incense and offerings, the street food and the common greeting of praying hands. The drama is also heightened by the huge cast and stellar performances from Viggo Mortensen and Colin Farrell - down to earth Brits, reluctant but determined volunteers, sharing custard creams. The fear and peril is palpable and the underwater diving sequences combined with the music and sound design keep you on the edge of your seat throughout. Hats off to everyone who helped get these boys out and for this fitting tribute to them all. Highly Recommend.

reviews.review_title: An Engaging, Methodical, Detail Focused, Re-Telling of a True Story
reviews.content: THIRTEEN LIVES (A-) is a riveting film that puts the incredible true story & the people who inhabited it at the center. Ron Howard's workman like directing is a perfect match here, eschewing any kind of deep message/subtext for a weighty verisimilitude. It's a smart choice that allows us to understand and honor what happened without piling on any unnecessary baggage. The art direction, cinematography, and score are all cinematic, but also have a sense of documentary realism to them. That realism is helped by two subtle but moving performances by Viggo Mortensen and Colin Farrell who play the head divers Rick Stanton and John Volanthen. I like that as the story plays out the end game of "how are we gonna get the boys out alive" is always haunting these two men until it becomes time to address it. If the boys weren't really sedated in the real evacuation, I'm not sure we would have believed it. This is one of those heartwarming and insightful true story films that you can't help but love.

reviews.review_title: This movie shows the promising future of Thai moviemaking
reviews.content: Over the last year, we already have seen how promising India moviemaking can be with the release of "Delhi Crime".With "Thirteen Lives", we now see that Thailand is also able to make some incredible good, Hollywood-style moviemaking!Off course it helps that e.g. Ron Howard, international actors and MGM are involved, but we surely should not forget the good acting of all involved thai actors. Children included!I hope this will be the start of a very promising future of more asian moviemaking!

Brilliantly acted and spectularly filmed dramatisation of the heroic cave rescue divers who went to Thailand as volunteers to give their expertise in trying to save a schoolboy football team and their young coach who had become trapped miles underground in a rapidly flooding cave system.If you followed this story as and when it happened, you will know how it panned out, but don't let that stop you watching this because it just reinforces the fact that these brave men were absolute heroes. The scenes as they laboriously make their way through the cave system, in often claustrophobic and perilous condition, are so well filmed and show the sheer strength and determination shown by not just by the divers but the hundreds of other people, both locals and internationals, to get the best possible outcome for the boys, their anxious parents and the watching media.Colin Farrell, Virgo Mortensen and Joel Edgerton are all fantastic in this. Tom Bateman also shines in a smaller role but is amazing in a scene where the stress and exhaustion overwhelms him.Above ground, a young water engineer and an old mountain man lead a team of people in the difficult job of trying to move the heavy flowing water cascading down in the monsoon and stop it from getting through into the caves. This work played a big part in the rescue and they did brilliantly.The actors playing the Governor and Minister are excellent, as well as the Thai Navy Seal leader and his team.This film is about 2 hrs 20 mins long but is never boring, it's emotional and inspirational in it's portrayal of so many people from all walks of life who came together in a time of crisis and achieved something wonderful.

For a long film the opening was sketchy and rushed.Curious choice of actors. No real English ones available? The accents are just about bearable... hmm or maybe not.I find the directing a bit pedestrian and it lacks the grittiness of the documentaryIt's probably best regarding diving scenes just because they could reenact them I guess.

An extraordinary rendition of the Thai flooded cave rescue which cements Ron Howard, if further proof was needed, in the panoply of top flght directors. The star cast wnt about the task in a no nonsense business like manner, telling the story as it was, with none of the Hollywood flourishes which can mar true life stories. A well deserved tribute to the rescuers who came from all across the world to support the competent Thai SEALS and the army of volunteers who worked to make the rescue possible. As an Aussie I am especially proud of our two medical specialist (anaesthetists) who came up with the successful plan. An inspirational movie.

How can anyone give this less than a 10. This is one of the best movies I have ever seen. It is up there with Saving Private Ryan, and Apollo 13. The realism of being under the water, the breathing, the tanks scrubbing on rocks, the struggles, the fear. I lost my breath with them many times. It is a subtle intensity that is difficult to capture on film. Mortensen and Ferrell are superb actors. Mortensen's cynical attitude was great. How did he not laugh at himself sometimes. Ferrell also just superb. And all the divers! Bravo. I was glad to see Edgerton can do more than Star Wars. He has real talent. Bateman's scene at the end, his fear, his disappointment, his relief. The struggle someone goes through to give up one life to save your own or you both die. Wry well done. I wanted to cry with him and give him a man hug.Like I said, who could give this less than 10. You were asleep, drunk or was hoping for death and nudity or you are just a moron. Sorry, I really like Stanton's honesty.

This movie is impressive and even though I knew the outcome it was completely tense and deeply immersive. Maybe knowing it was a real situation added to my anxiety. My heart was literally pounding over the tight spaces and made my claustrophobia sky rocket. Xanax was the only way for me to watch the whole film.I liked that no one was portrayed having huge egos, just humble hero's that put their life on the line. It was interesting to see how they worked through the ethical issues. The rescue was a group effort and the outcome was truly a miracle. I hope these kids got psychological counseling afterwards because the PTSD from the experience must be strong.I think Ron Howard knocked this one out of the park.

reviews.review_title: Fantastic cast! brilliant acting! brilliant directing! honestly couldn't have been better!!!!
reviews.content: This movie honestly couldn't have been better! An outstanding job by all the cast involved and the directors! The storyline is easy to follow and the graphics are beyond fantastic. This film keeps you at the edge of your seat. I began watching this film thinking that I would be disappointed, however, I was far from it. In fact, I can't think of anything that could make this film better because they nailed everything and that's what makes it a genuinely fantastic film. If you're contemplating about whether or not to watch this film, my advice is definitely watch it! You will NOT be disappointed!!!

This film surprised me by being able to portray almost all the significant events of the rescue. The previous documentary about this, even the one with the actual British rescuers, did not cover everything including those from the boys perspective and the rescuers. The only other missing things were the argument and ensuing law suits between Elon Musk and a member of the the rescue team when Elon tried to interject himself into the operation.

You know a movie is truly great when you already know how it ends, but it keeps you on the edge of your seat anyway! This was an amazing story of heroes and humanity that needed Ron Howard to retell it again in his masterful way, together with excellent acting and cinematography. I cried and I cheered. Some have complained the movie was too long. I was actually sorry it ended when it did.

This recreation is far beneath the ability of a director like Ron Howard, but I guess they wanted to do it without making too many mistakes, and unfortunately it comes out like a paint-by-numbers - a true life survival story that easily appeals to the viewer, as long as it doesn't drag too long, and elicits all the right feel-good moments. I did shed a tear occasionally, but it felt manipulated and I felt dirty afterwards. When the poor farmers agreed to give up their crop, without even asking for a dime of government assistance, imagine the sacrifice! It works for a moment - it does touch the heart for a second or two - but in the back of your mind something feels off. How did they all end up on that porch? The farmers didn't ask for compensation before agreeing to give up their means of survival? The heroic governor didn't even offer?Other such fabrications, sometimes used to heighten the tension during the cave rescue - like fishing for dropped needles as the boy is waking up - seem suspiciously over-the-top.

reviews.review_title: "I have zero interest in dying. How about you, John?"
reviews.content: An intense, excellently performed, well paced, beautifully shot dramatisation of a miraculous true story that will have you holding your breathe for a solid 2 and a half hours.

reviews.review_title: Great balance between accuracy and drama
reviews.content: I followed this story (as much of thew world did) and have also seen various documentaries on it. This film strikes a very good balance between accuracy and drama. It is very well directed by Ron Howard and the 2 leads are great in it. It also tries to tell it as a story of true international collaboration, although it has slight bias towards the UK and Australian cave rescue team which I think is understandable. One of the most complex and difficult cave rescues in history is told in riveting fashion. Highly recommended. NOTE: As one or two others have said this is best seen on a large screen with good surroud sound as the audio in the caves gives a really great immersive experience.

I can't think of a single thing I would change in this movie. Not one thing. Caste. Performances. Cinematography. Locations. Directing. Editing. Everything about it was perfect. I didn't realise this was a Ron Howard movie till I looked here, which is funny because as I was watching it, it reminded me in a way of another Howard movie - Apollo 13. Even though everyone already knew the ending, it was still intensely dramatic and gripping. I also never realised just how magnificent and remarkable the rescue was until watching it here. The best indication of how good this movie was is this: it runs for 150 minutes, but I was never bored. Not a second was wasted.

I read another review that recommended the NatGeo version of the story over this film, so I checked it out. You can watch The Rescue on Disney+. It was just as amazing but I think I appreciated the documentary more because of the film. Well done Ron Howard! I haven't seen a good human interest story in so long. The way things unfolded were truly a miracle. Human kindness still prevails. God bless all who contributed to this amazing effort.

reviews.review_title: A celebration of love, selfless sacrifice and heroism
reviews.content: Exceptional. Even though we know how it ends, the script, character development, twists and turns kept my heart racing for most of the movie. A great set and attention to detail made it completely believable. A celebration of love, selfless sacrifice and heroism.

Absolutely unreal! Brilliant retelling of this incredible S story. No one but Ron Howard could have done this so masterfully. The cast is brilliant; making you feel every emotion that these families and rescuers must have felt. So many heroes that must never be forgotten. I hope those beautiful boys get to live long and happy lives!
I don't usually write reviews but Ron Howard did a fantastic job on this film. Anyone who says otherwise is just too critical for their own good. Must watch!
What a beautiful movie! It proves that humans can do wonders if they decide to help each other. This movie portrays it beautifully. There are many tensed moments during the rescue operation.

Cast and Director top,notch. Only thing I wish they showed how the spiritual monk predicted how one will not survive. The diving scenes were intense and you could sense how gripping the situation was.

Once again Ron captivated us with his great movie making skills. He didn't over do it with the dramatic tension and kept it completely realistic. I had no idea all the people with their different skill sets were involved in this rescue. Amazing what all the different peoples of this planet can do when we have common goal.

reviews.review_title: An amazing film - very well recommended watch!
reviews.content: Wasn't expecting much from this film but so pleased I didn't pass it over .Great casting and acting. Viggo Mortensen an eccentric cynical but passionate cave rescuer , and Colin Farrell surperb unassuming acting , supported well by Joel Edgerton and many of the Thai actorsUnbelievable filming of underwater scenes creating a thrilling heart stopping emotional ride .Was not aware of the method used to rescue the boys except that they happily survived .This was approached as a docufilm style but had good character development of both rescuers and families involved .Very unassuming but definitely a good watch !

reviews.review_title: Awesome, although you know how it ends
reviews.content: A world-famous flooded cave rescue story, although the details only became clear to me through this movie. Great actors, well told and performed. And in a time full of crises, something like a spark of hope.

On location, local actors, Viggo Mortensen and Colin Farrell what could go wrong? Ron Howard stays true to the facts and the story, and in doing so eliminates every trace of emotion or real suspense.When this even happened in real life, people around the world were praying for those boys; terrified that the reality was some would die. What was accomplished was nothing less than a miracle made possible by humans working together. I didn't get the sense of that watching this, and there is zero footage of what it might have been like for the boys inside.The location shots are nice, the diving shots are fine. The reminders on screen of the cave system and which links were which were handy. The performance by Mortensen and Farrell at least are watchable, but that reduces the interesting parts of the film to the two British divers instead of the boys that it should be about.In all I found it forgettable, though the long technical expertise of Ron Howard comes through on pacing.Skip unless you don't know the ending.

A superb telling of the true story of the famous cave rescue mission in Thailand. This movie is a masterclass of how a docudrama should be done i.e. Stick to the story and facts without box-ticking side plots. The action footage is superb and extremely realistic, as is the portrayal of the main characters. Highly recommended.

Good film, we'll directed and shot. Really get a sense of the chlostraphobia . Liked most of film but unfortunately Colin Farrell cannot do a neutral English accent - it comes across as someone trying to be dour in order to catch the right accent and Viggo Mortensen is not much better. He was in and out of a decent attempt at an accent . Shame. The documentary was more riveting but not a bad film at all.

Ron Howard does not disappoint all 2 hrs 27 min. Amazing underwater scenes - re-creating what truly happened. So many brave men risking their life to help the young boys. The boys coach is a hero, keeping the boys alive for many many days.

This man was getting on my LAST nerve. His whole attitude had me wanted to strangle him. I'm all for false hope, but come on.Made me think of the miners that were trapped. Much easier since had to do so much before could rescue the boys.My thing, why weren't they already thinking of a plan while searching?Even though knew everyone made it out safely, that Chris part was great. I loved each diver knew their pkg name.

I had great expectations for this film, because I know what Ron Howard can do. With a running time of 2 1/2 hours, I reserved an extra evening and sat down in front of the screen armed with ice cream. Right from the start I had the impression that this was more like a film from 20 years ago. The aesthetics were unusually "old-fashioned", but that didn't bother me. Unfortunately, the story never really got going and apart from a few exciting underwater moments, everything seemed quite well-behaved and dialogue-heavy. Of course, the actors were (mostly) good, but why do you need 150 minutes for such a minimalist story, which also lacked any background as to who the characters are? In the end, I played with my mobile phone several times in between and had the feeling at the end that nothing would linger here. And so it is. I am disappointed.

I remember following this story in real time but until this movie did not understand the scale of the rescue effort.The movie is great and really captures the human elements, you get a feel for the gravity of the situation.I was amazed at the cave diving scenes and the actors portrayed the real life hero's, the young actors playing the boys were unbelievable. The movie makes it very clear of how difficult and complicated the rescue efforts were, the importance of time and the consequences of a failed rescue.It's one of the best dramatised true story movies I've watched was gripped from start to finish.I recommend watching the documentary also, you get more appreciation for the detail the movie was able to capture.

This is a true story. Ron Howard has done it again. Made us proud to be living dedicated human beings. If you do not feel good after watching this movie then you do not have a pulse. It is long but so is the tragedy taking place in front of you. Colin and Vergo are really into their roles. Thank you for sharing this epic story.

This would be a good film if it wasn't a true story - the fact it is makes it great.Gripping from start to finish. Excellent performances from the whole cast. Well written & well shot. As far as I'm aware, true to real events.I didn't cry until the very end, when the text came up. People can be awful, yet when tragedy strikes, it always amazes me how everyone comes together. So many people gave their time, their livelihoods, and risked their lives to help complete strangers. It's a beautiful story of human resilience, ingenuity, compassion, and sacrifice.No negatives except I didn't find it quite as edge-of-your-seat-exciting as others seemed to. That may just be because we already knew how it was going to end, though. Overall, really enjoyable and definitely worth a watch, even if just to learn what happened and to honour those who died.

reviews.review_title: Hard to beat a story like this.
reviews.content: Lovely feelgood movie but based in reality! Who couldn't love this rescue?It may seem a bit western-patronising but, apparently, that's really how it was: the British divers and Australian doctor did the rescue. Not colonial, just expertise developed in the limestone holes of Yorkshire.Every respect to the Thai Navy Seals who gave their lives.And, in case anyone is wondering, Elon Musk is afforded all the respect due to him: he isn't mentioned at all. But I can't help thinking that Vernon Unsworth would've won if he'd brought his libel action in England where the libel laws are much tougher than in the US.

The movie was very well done - how they shot it was nothing short of amazing, you felt like you were there. The acting was also great & they really captured how incredibly difficult this rescue was. My only critique is I wish there was more, there is no background to anybody, you don't know anything about the kids or the divers. There is no personalization, if that makes sense.They also missed out on adding little things, like why the boys went out in the order they did, what the boys went through in that cave, etc...I highly recommend watching The Rescue, it gives detailed interviews with the divers and adds much more to the story. I wish there was just more a personal look into the rescue instead of it just being mostly 100% about the technical issues of the dive. But overall, well done.

reviews.review_title: A perfect tribute to the brave people that make this miracle
reviews.content: Congratulations to the director and all staff of the film and to the real people that with brave and knowledge save the life of these 13 lives. The kindness of civilisation has no limits.
An absolutely incredible film!Tense, engaging and heart wrenching all at the same time. A truly inspiring story of human resilience, survival and an unbroken spirit.

reviews.review_title: Had us on the edge of our seats
reviews.content: Incredibly tense movie. My wife and I knew that all the kids made it out alive. But we were still extremely anxious watching the rescue. Would watch again. The ending had us in tears.

Any time Ron Howard does a based on real events, you know it will be great.All of the crew are fabulous. Not one of them has a noticeably "big head" that they are a bigger star than the guy next to them.There are different points of view:
1-The families
2-The village at large
3-The volunteers
4-The divers (our protagonists)
5-The government people
It works in that, yes, this is in Thailand. So people speak Thai...not many know English. So language barriers are a problem.It works in religious beliefs were very important to the people there.It NEVER MENTIONS ELON MUSK and his BS he tried to do concerning this. Thank God. The men who pulled off this rescue deserve the credit they have gotten and none of the name calling Mollusk tried to put upon any of them.The underwater cave scenes are very realistic and make you feel as if you are holding your breath.

What makes this movie so great is that it's factual and there was no added fluff or drama or some ridiculous love tale that directors tend to add into real story movies. This was only about the rescue itself, the mindset of the rescuers and the heart-wrenching emotions of the families and everyone who witnessed it. It absolutely had me on edge the entire time. The filming was so well done that you felt you were right there at times. I didn't know the story, so for me, I didn't know how it ended which made it all the more frightening. There is a documentary as well called The Rescue. But if you're looking for a beautifully done gut-wrenching tale about true heroes, sacrifice and hope....you'll love this movie.Really impressed by Amazon with this one. Normally I don't like their movies, but this had me from beginning to end.I will also note that if you're claustrophobic, it might trigger you. It's hard to watch at points. I could feel myself stop breathing at times.

Even though you know the outcome, it still has you on the edge of your seat, waiting to see what will happen. A pretty straight up movie that is based solely on facts, with no added fiction necessary for effects. The diving scenes gave me such anxiety, I can't imagine anything more terrifying. Well done to Ron Howard and the entire cast.

The magnitude of the rescue efforts were mind blowing. And when you think of how many things that could have gone wrong - OMG. This is a fantastic movie that will fill you with anxiety and make you feel like you're right there with the heroic rescuers.

reviews.review_title: What a joke of a movie.
reviews.content: This film portrays the Thai Navy as incompetent fools, who cannot swim or use SCUBA gear correctly and just give up. It's only then that out of nowhere a British and Australian "diving expert" happen upon the scene. Only these two guys have the balls to dive and find these missing boys. First of all this movie, if you want to call it that, is complete fantasy. Talk about taking directorial license to do whatever Ron Howard wants to do. In every dive scene they make the Thai divers look like imbeciles who have no concept of diving or of rescue. WTF Ronnie ?? Don't watch this piece of crap. It's embarrassing to see and if you tell your friends that you saw this film, be prepared to be ridiculed for stupidity.

It's really a good movie that you can't take an eye off your screen from the moment it's aghre until the end of the film. It is very meaningful and represents the hard work and efforts of those who gave their lives to save these twelve boys. We can say that they are real heroes, as well as their coach and the kids themselves who were able to survive in these difficult situations. The film has a variety of scenes that excite the viewer, and it will be very hard to turn a blind eye to the screen. I suggest you that this It's really a good movie that you can't take an eye off your screen from the moment it's aghre until the end of the film. It is very meaningful and represents the hard work and efforts of those who gave their lives to save these twelve boys. We can say that they are real heroes, as well as their coach and the kids themselves who were able to survive in these difficult situations. The film has a variety of scenes that excite the viewer, and it will be very hard to turn a blind eye to the screen. I suggest you To be sure to see this wonderful movie.

This film keeps you on the edge of your seat the whole time. Not only is this a true story but the depictions of cave diving, the rescue, and everything that went into saving these boys is top notch and accurate to T. There are some amazing cave divers out there but few are considered the best. The fact that it wasn't any form of military that was called to save these souls, it was these British cave divers. Who do this for fun and to push the sport of diving forward. That was so interesting. Shout out to all the amazing cave divers from Florida too. All in all, great great film. It kept the pace of the film swift, exciting, and covered the many different aspects of this life and death situation. When the main diver says, there are seldom cave rescues, and are mostly cave recoveries it really conveys the depth(pun) of the situation. Seriously, look it up. Anyways 9 stars easy. Anyone who dives or enjoys a good solid film will enjoy this....

reviews.review_title: Ron Howard has delivered another masterpiece!
reviews.content: This is an amazing story of hope, community spirit, and worldwide involvement. Ron Howard has done an amazing job of bringing this story to us, and keeping us totally absorbed until the very end. Viggo Mortensen and Colin Farrell showed their characters' determination and skill, and were perfect choices in their roles. This is a "feel good" movie that will not disappoint you!

Expectedly bombastic stuff from Howard.Hyperactive direction , editing and soundtrack to ramp up the emotion.Very expensive production values.All put together to make your heart race.Totally transparent.The story is incredible enough to not need this kind of hyperbole.

I actually hadn't heard of this movie until my son mentioned it and the brilliant actors in it. Watched it and wow, everything comes together. The actors, the children and their parents. This story is one of those that you won't get out of your head easily. How the boys were taken out wow wow wow, unbelievable.Totally enjoyed this movie.

I am surprised how come I never saw any AD or talk in social media about this movie.I went to watch this movie on Amazon Prime without much expectation thinking its one of those low budget movies straight to video kind of movies.But boy was I in for a surprise :-)A beautiful movie which beautifully captures the raw emotion & thrill surrounding the Thai cave rescue.Definitely worth a watch and definitely worth a watch in movie theatres if its available in one near your home.

I appreciate how Ron captured ALL of the heroes. He showed their human side as well and that is what draws you in....it's like you're going through the experience with them. Awesome heart touching film.

Breathtaking movie you will watch in a heartbeat ... and than watch it again...
A well-chosen cast, an extremely realistic presentation, tense from start to finish...
Well done!Absolutely must watch!

This film truly left no stone unturned in its details when it correctly depicts the northern Thai dialect spoken by the residents and villagers of the Chiang Rai province of Thailand. Authentic to form, the government officials and military speak central Thai dialect which would be understood by the people of the region, but while most western viewers would not know the difference, this key detail shows an exceptional attention to authenticity which sets this film on a whole other level. So many movies set in Thailand have actors who speak very little or who can not even speak Thai at all. This movie was by far one of the best Western films to accurately depict the Thai language and dialects.In addition, the culture and religion of the people is depicted very accurately.The scenery and film sets both inside and outside of the cave were very realistic down to the last details. Very impressive cave sets which would be nearly impossible to distinguish from the real thing on film.Casting was perfect and believable.In watching this film I was quite literally transported back to Thailand in my mind. The accuracy of this film is impeccable.

reviews.review_title: Gripping Account of the Thai Cave Rescue Defies the Odds and Inspires Hope
reviews.content: If you're looking for an intense and emotionally gripping film, then this is a must-see. Ron Howard delivers a riveting account of the 2018 Thai cave rescue, in which a team of divers and rescuers worked tirelessly to save a group of young boys and their soccer coach from an underground cave system that was rapidly flooding.Despite the grim reality of the situation, Howard's direction never feels exploitative or melodramatic. He stays true to the facts and avoids unnecessary embellishments, which only adds to the sense of urgency and tension.The film does an excellent job of conveying the enormity of the challenge the rescuers faced, and the tremendous risks they took to bring the boys to safety. The sense of claustrophobia is palpable, and the cinematography is outstanding, immersing you in the dark, dank world of the caves.One thing that was striking was that the boys themselves are not given much individual characterization. But this is precisely the point: they were twelve unknown boys who suddenly became the focus of a worldwide rescue effort. By keeping the focus on the rescuers and their herculean efforts, Howard underscores the enormity of the task at hand.It truly shows testament to the courage and determination of the human spirit. It's a film that will keep you on the edge of your seat, and leave you feeling inspired and hopeful about our capacity for kindness and compassion in times of crisis. Highly recommend!!

The movie is extremely suspenseful and intense. As soon as the story starts, your anxiety level will start to rise and it will keep on rising until the end. A big salute to the real divers. They did a great job.

What an epic journey from start to finish Howard has you glued to the screen experiencing every high and low with the actors.While the story made headlines all over the world you still couldn't help feeling the palpable tension as the divers formed their crazy idea and executed it to rescue those boys.My nerves are shredded...The sign of a master craftsman. Well done to everyone who made this film.And.

One of the few movies that doesn't use Hollywood tomfoolery to display this incredible story. How this movie wasn't released in theaters is beyond me, as the acting, scenery, and storyline were absolutely perfect.From the assembly of the dive team, to the cohesiveness of the soccer team and coach, the display of tireless effort by the local villagers to divert water away from above the caves, the claustrophobic spaces deep within the cave, the loss of the Thai Navy Seal, and the brilliant idea to anesthetize the children to safely transfer them from the cave, this movie captured it all.We need more movies like this, with real heros, and not garbage Hollywood and Marvel keep producing.This movie runs 2.5 hours, and is well worth the entire watch. Some clown reviewing this movie on IMDB was complaining that it was too long, and they fast forwarded through parts, but I would highly recommend watching it through and through.Wow, just wow!

BRILLIANT MOVIE WITH A FACTUAL REPRESENTATION OF THE ACTUAL DISASTER IN WHICH 13 THAILAND BOYS WERE TRAPPED IN A CAVE THE RESCUE OPERATION CONSISTED OF ELITE DIVERS FROM BRITAIN AND OTHER COUNTRIES AFTER THE THAI NAVY DIVER DIED . CINEMATOGRAPHY IS AMAZING AND SHOULD ACTUALLY BE WATCHED ON a BIG SCREEN TO GET THE BEAUTIFUL THAI MOUNTAINS...YET A BRILLIANT MASTERPIECE OF 2022.

reviews.review_title: Probably the best streaming-service commissioned film so far
reviews.content: In an ocean of redundant Hallmark and explosive action movies made for streaming this is a breath of fresh air, through an underwater respirator. It's a movie with a lot of heart and great acting by the leads. The cinematography is incredibly tense, there is no reason not to watch this film.

reviews.review_title: Rich telling of a riveting story
reviews.content: After seeing the docudrama "Thirteen Lives" trailer, I feared that "Thirteen Lives" would be an over-done hype piece, but actually it was a rich portrayal of the many complexities in grappling with the true story of the Thai cave tragedy. It was hard to see Colin Farrell and (especially) Viggo Mortense as over-the-hill dweebs they were supposed to play, but they are exceptional actors and they depicted their characters very effectively which actually downplayed their role as heroes compared to the documentary.I recommend watching documentary about the event, "The Rescue", first as it is more hard-hitting and all the more so seeing the full story depicted for the first time. "Thirteen Lives" is a fine follow-up, almost like a "director's cut" of the story which delves into more detail (2.5 hours of detail) into depicting more of the surrounding players (local farmers, the families, local authorities, the boys themselves) than "The Rescue" (which focused more on the rescue operation).
This is based on "actual" events not true story lol and remind you it's Hollywood, so it's neither. Just watch a long Hollywood movie or don't or skip it.

The movie is great shout. Viggo Mortensen.and Colin Farrell make great job in acting as do the other part cast. The movie itself brings culture religion etc into the narrative and the effort community save the boys. Yet get suspenseful claustrophobic moments.leave you on edge it doesn't discriminate its about heroes working together to save lives.

reviews.review_title: A must-watch....wil restore your faith in human beings.
reviews.content: While long, it is a majestic glimpse into how truly good human beings can be. That this rescue was successful is a testament to a vast community working together, sacrificing so much and winning in the end. Ron Howard did a fabulous job bringing this miraculous rescue to the screen for all to see. This rescue was a miracle thanks to the people who were willing to sacrifice everything to save those thirteen young people, the boys and their coach who kept them alive and calm for nearly 20 days.

reviews.review_title: One of the best movies I've seen!
reviews.content: Such a great story !!!! It was so emotional, so realistic , I even cried ! And all the acting was brilliant! ! This people are heroes!!!Well done for the great job that they did rescuing the boys !!! I highly recommend this movie. Must be watched !

Excellent presentation of true story, I am not able to describe my feelings in words.The kids and the coach were very courageous who lived for 9 days without eating and drinkingAnother example of team work.Love from India.Ankit.

This film was always going to be a dramatic dilution of what these guys did and achieved - the documentary was brilliantly made and strung together and never let up! Which was obviously what the divers felt for the weeks they were active before the rescue which was nothing short of a miracle (or these gents absolute professionalism and dedication).

This movie fails to tell a good story and give you any emotional connection to the story or characters. It's actually an extremely boring movie - a shame really given the cast and true story behind its.

I've already watched this on Amazon... however if it were to have a theatrical release I would go to see it in a first rate cinema. This is so good it should be allowed to qualify for Oscar nominations. One of the best of the year so far.
Lost for words. I followed this event on the news and to see it as a movie is still just as heart moving. Excellent acting which isn't forced or portrayed as acting. It was real.
This is a disgrace to everyone involved in what happened.If you want the actual story, without all the fluff, go watch The Rescue, that was made by National Geographic.

reviews.review_title: Acting, directing, photography, scripting all first rate
reviews.content: The only way this could've been better would be more character development and dialog with the main characters, and more depth on the politics and technical difficulties. But it's already a 2 1/2 hour film, and that woul push it out even further. Ron Howard nailed it. The cinematography is amazing. The film feels like quality beginning to end.
Starts a little slow but man what an incredible story, pretty darn accurate portrayal, I recommend following it up with the National Geographic documentary afterwards, great casting.

It's good, it's enjoyable BUT it's lacking something I can't explain and I've no idea what that is? It's like a 5000 price jigsaw of beauty but you can't find the last bit! I still enjoyed it but I feel all the early Oscars buzz might be premature, we'll see in time. Most claustrophobic tension Oscar is in the bag though :-)

It was incredible to see the efforts and sacrifices made not only from the actual rescuers but also from all the volunteers, especially those diverting the water. Also, watching the evolution of the Navy Seal's attitude and respect towards the rescuers was perfectly captured.

I was on the edge of my seat from start to finish even though I followed the story at the time and knew the details of what happened. It's an amazing--truly unbelievable--real-life story told skillfully by a great director (Ron Howard) starring a wonderful cast. Even the smaller roles are beautifully portrayed. Top notch! A rare gem in a sea of mediocrity.

Finally a Amazon original that was done right, great cast, great story, great director, great movie. This should be a template for all streaming sights to use when trying to create movies of any note.

The movie was thrilling from beginning to the end. Enjoyed the movie a lot even though we had to turn closed caption due to the Thai subtitles. It is considered an English language film but a large of the dialogue is in Thai.

reviews.review_title: Kept me on the edge of the seat ...
reviews.content:
This is a very good movie, true story which makes it even better, an incredible rescue, thanks to incredible unselfish people( angels on earth)
The movie should have shown the faces of the 2 English man that basically made the rescue possible and the anesthetic doctor that administered the drugs to save the children .Defined recommend this movie you can watch it with your entire family as it has no violence nor immoral content, a rate thing to say about a movie this days .For what I read the cave is now only open in the main area then is restricted , which makes sense to avoid future incidents.I don't know what else I need to say for this review to be allowed.

The critics mediocre to bad reviews of this film boggle the mind. For the most part they're flat out wrong. Even though one knows the story, the suspense is palpable. The sense that one is watching the events play out in real time is never-wracking in the best way. The joy at the end is real. Watch Thirteen Lives - you won't be disappointed.

What a wonderful way to honor those involved in this phenomenal real-life story! This film by director Ron Howard captured the drama and emotion through the excellent acting of Colin Ferrell and Viggo Mortensen as well as the spectacular setting and culture of Thailand. I highly recommend this film, and hope it gets its due respect during Oscar season!

reviews.review_title: God Damn!!! This is a ride...
reviews.content: Ron Howard is a Hollywood icon who can be respected without reservation. No drama, career disappointment or sabotage. He does not disappoint here. Very well made, with good effects, acting, and pacing. I usually hate true life stories turned into movies. But Ron Howard has made another masterpiece. Apollo 13 was more visually stimulating, and arguably a better movie. However, Ron Howard is a master of the true life story movie genre, and this movie deserves praise... Truly heart warming and inspiring... It shows the power of good that is inherent in all of us, and heroes who don't want to be, but act anyway...

If this wasn't a true story it would feel unbelievable. A wonderful depiction of what the boys and divers experienced. With all that is happening in the world, this truly restores your faith in humanity. A heart wrenching story that leaves you wondering if the "miracle" finale was caused by their faith in prayer.

This was an amazing movie. I had to turn away a few times when they were going thru the caves under water. I've never had a movie actually induce fear of claustrophobia like this did. Definitely in my top 10 movies of all time!

I was pretty interested in these events as they played out and also watched the documentary. This seemed super accurate to what I know. Acting was on point. The difficult of filming that film alone gives it 10 stars for me. Just great.

reviews.review_title: A good Film about how skill and training can save lives
reviews.content: Very few films about Diving impress me, having dived for over 20 years. This one did. If you watch a film about diving, watch this one. Those men, who these actors played well, were hero's, in the truest sense of that expression.

reviews.review_title: #1 - WAY WAY WAY TOO LONG & REPETITIVE
reviews.content: Yawn. 2.5 hours of basically the same thing over and over and over. Since I know the true story there is zero suspense. The only really redeeming thing is the work of Colin Farrell who I think is The best actor in movies nowadays. All the other actors are pretty one note and - yes knowing it's a Ron Howard thing helps lean me toward negativity.

Absolutely amazing.Just like Apollo 13, Mr. Howard has taken a story that everyone knows and made it suspenseful.I suspect it is because of the detail.I knew the story of Apollo 13, but not the detail.I knew the story of this rescue, but not the detail.I had no idea that the boys were sedated to save them from even more horror and to help the experts to bring them out as safely as possible.I absolutely loved the idea of using an empty water bottle as a flotation device strapped between the boys ankles.
Excellent acting, direction and cinematography. The story is so incredible that it's hard to believe it's all true. Great work. Kept me on the edge of my seat and I knew what happened!

The whole time you feel depressed, suffocating, anxiety and a mere feeling of wanting to be happy but the next thing you know you're back in sad part of it.The cinema itself again shows how humans can do better by working as a team. It is the basic of survival. I would definitely recommend it to my loved one.

Turned it off after 20 mins. Why make this when there is The Rescue? Don't get me started on the acting. I'll have to take other users word for it that Joel Edgerton saves the film in the acting department, we didn't make it that far.

Thrilling, but more than that, an accurate tribute. Entertaining (respectfully using this word) segue amd buildup of the events. The perspective (almost exclusively from the point of the rescue mission)ames this film particular. Immersive experience from a cinematic pov.

I must say, this movie is quite unnecessary when the excellent documentary The Rescue (2021) exist. The documentary is better in every way (including story arch and representation), so I can't really see why you should spend time watching this instead.Anyway, the film itself isn't that bad, but I didn't find the story told in a very captivating way and also the acting was often quite flawed and stiff (Viggo did a good job, though).Watch the documentary instead.

Thirteen Lives is based on Real events,13 School Football Team Kids got Trapped in a CAVE, during the (monsoon season) with no way out, WORLD came together to do the impossible, Rescue 13 school kids under a cave filled with water, The World Best Divers saw it has a suicide Mission, having no way of knowing if the kids were alive, The Monsoon-Season Made it even more impossible, has the water level kept rising up inside the Cave. The Rescue came up with a plan, they the tried to drain some of the water out of the cave, Day 4 after trying to drain some of the Rain water out of the cave with no Success, The Rescue came up with one of the most Drastic plan, with no other option,. The Plans was to place a Diving Team inside the cave at each point over 100 miles with a (Gas Tank) and a guiding rope throughout the cave, getting to kids was Tricky, the last part of the plan was giving the kids Anesthesia, To keep them came while travelling inside the Cave water with a Gas Tank. The diverse at every check point in the Cave most stop to check the kids they were traveling with and give the anesthesia to kids, secondly change the Gas Tank, it took( A Day) for the First kid to be out of the Cave. During the process of saving other kids one of the Divers died due to lack of oxygen, his Gas tank got empty😭 He died has An HERO. Watching the Real Time story on Nat Geo Geographic give me goosebumps.
An amazing story exceptionally well portrayed, directed and produced. Truly life-affirming. A wonderful, engrossing story that I will not soon forget.As another reviewer said: Thank You Ron Howard!

I remember seeing this on the news and watched it unfold. This incredible movie gives you much more insight in what the locals did to divert the water going into the cave and saved the boys lives, so they did not drown. It was the amazing work of the English, Thai, Americans and a brilliant Aussie to save the boys. The acting is great, cast is brilliant and I am truly in awe of these guys did to save these 13 boys from that cave. The narrow cave passageways and the bravery of the divers to risk their own lives, will warm your heart and bring a tear to your eye. Loved this movie and it's a long movie but it's worth every minute of your time.

The film "Thirteen lives" tells about a real amazing story that happened in Thailand. This story about the "Thirteen Lives" unfolded over 17 days in the summer of 2018 in the Tham Luang Nang Non Cave, where school-age children and their coach go for a walk.The sudden onset of the rainy season spoils the children's summer hike, putting them in danger. 13 lives of schoolchildren and their coach were at stake, risking to remain forever in the labyrinth of a water-filled cave. The probability that they would come out unharmed was getting closer to zero every day.The timing of the project takes about 2.5 hours. In the allotted time, the director decides to show the process of a special operation from 0 to successful completion. And also indirectly affecting the equally important fate of minor characters (as an immigrant parent of one of the victims).The intense plot, which director Ron Harward was able to convey, does not let go until the end, which already could not believe in the fact that the young guys were able to survive in a damp cave. Taking full responsibility for the children, the coach did not panic, taught them meditation and was able to correctly distribute the amount of food for 9 days before they were found by rescuers. Thanks to their leader, the children were unharmed, apart from physical indicators such as weakness and low temperature.The only thing that is not completed for me is that the saved characters were not revealed in the film. That is, it was not fully told and filmed how the team got into such a dead end of the cave and how they were able to find the highest point of the cave from the filled water. How and when they realized that they were stuck in a cave, and other similar questions I asked while watching. Considering that the film was made about the victims, I think the main characters were few. There was a feeling that rescuers and security services stood in 1 row compared to the final object.Overtaking all these disadvantages, the authors of the project were able to cover up the shortcomings of the work.
